content:
• Tuesday, October 15, 2013

  • After-Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top Gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: DMD +10%. BORN +7%. GERN +4%. AMRN +3%. PKD-OLD +3%.
    • Top Losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: WTSL -9%. CBB -4%. LLTC -4%. GDP -3%. EXPR -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • LLTC

    Linear Tech beats by $0.06, beats on revenues

    • Linear Tech (NASDAQ:LLTC): FQ1 EPS of $0.52 beats by $0.06.
    • Revenue of $340.4M (+2% Y/Y) beats by $1.14M. Shares -3.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • JOEZ

    Joe's Jeans misses by $0.01, misses on revenues

    • Joe's Jeans (NASDAQ:JOEZ): Q3 EPS of $0.01 misses by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $29.4M (-3% Y/Y) misses by $3.97M. Shares -11% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • GDP

    Goodrich Petroleum -3% on 6M-share offering, raises capex estimates

    • Goodrich Petroleum (NYSEMKT:GDP) -3% AH after announcing a public offering of 6M common shares to fund the acceleration of its drilling program in the Tuscaloosa Marine Shale, including an increase in its number of horizontal rigs from two to five by the end of 2014.
    • GDP says the enhanced drilling will raise total 2013 capex to ~$255M from its previous $230M capital budget estimate, and it expects its 2014 capital budget to total $375M.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology misses by $0.08, misses on revenues

    • OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ): FQ2 EPS of -$0.26 misses by $0.08.
    • Revenue of $33.5M misses by $6.64M. Shares -3.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • CSX

    CSX beats by $0.03

    • CSX (NYSE:CSX): Q3 EPS of $0.46 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $3B beats by $0.06B. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • BXE

    Bellatrix announces $576M acquisition, $240M exploration JV

    • Bellatrix Exploration (BXE -4.1%) enters into a $240M joint venture partnership with TCA Energy to drill and develop lands in the Ferrier Cardium area of Alberta; TCA will contribute 50% towards the capital program for the drilling of an expected 63 gross wells, and in exchange will receive 35% of BXE's working interest.
    • BXE also agrees to acquire Canadian-based oil and gas explorer Angle Energy (OTCPK:ANGZF) in a deal valued at ~$576M.
    • BXE plans to issue ~21.8M common shares on a bought deal basis at $8 each for total gross proceeds of ~$175M.
    • BXE shares halted.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • AMRN

    Amarin rises ahead of pivotal Vascepa advisory committee meeting

    • Amarin (AMRN +3.9%) looks set to close notably higher ahead of tomorrow's key Vascepa label expansion advisory committee meeting.
    • Jefferies is out with a rather specific prediction: "We analyzed the last 13 FDA endocrine panel meetings, specifically the votes and relevant commentary from the 10 committee members on AMRN's Wed panel [and] we predict a 7-3 vote in favor of approval."
    • AMRN will host a call to discuss the results of the meeting tomorrow night at 7.
    • More on the meeting here
     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • RIO

    Rio Tinto's production gains, Chinese iron ore demand lift global miners

    • Rio Tinto's (RIO +2.9%) announcement that iron ore production had hit a record level is boosting other iron mining stocks: CLF +4.4%, VALE +1%, BHP +0.3%.
    • RIO and the other miners no doubt also are enjoying a boost from a resurgent China, where iron ore prices have rebounded 21% to $133.60/ton from a late-May low; China's iron ore imports in September totaled a record 74.6M metric tons, up 15% Y/Y.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • PRKR

    ParkerVision reverses and climbs as jury deliberation begins in Qualcomm suit

    • Shares of ParkerVision (OTC:PRKR +19.5%) have reversed earlier losses and are climbing as the jury begins deliberations in the company's patent infringement lawsuit against Qualcomm.
    • Daniel Ravicher observes with chagrin that Qualcomm did not call an expert/company representative to provide a rebuttal to ParkerVision's infringement assertions and gave up on its obviousness claim.
    • Previous: ParkerVision seeks $500M for past damages in Qualcomm suit
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • DGX

    Just how much pricing pressure will Myriad Genetics face?

    • "Not everyone agrees that a race to the bottom is in the works," writes Forbes' Matthew Herper, regarding the contention that Quest Diagnostics' (DGX -0.9%) attempt to enter the BRCA testing market at a relatively low price point may mark the beginning of a trend towards sharply lower prices, a prospect that has some Myriad Genetics (MYGN -2.1%) shareholders spooked.
    • "MYGN has ... other patents that were not touched by the Supreme Court decision, it controls a proprietary database of which variants in the BRCA1 and BRCA2 genes increase the risk of breast and ovarian cancer, and by how much, and it has developed a good reputation among cancer doctors and gynecologists," Herper notes.
    • Nevertheless, some commentators, such as Stanford's Oncology Division Chief George Sledge maintain that "it doesn’t make much sense from a technology standpoint that [testing] should be this expensive."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • HMY

    Harmony Gold reports production +12% Q/Q

    • Harmony Gold (HMY +3.5%) reports total Q3 production is expected to come in ~12% higher than the prior quarter; production at its underground mines in South Africa is ~15% higher Q/Q, while Hidden Valley's production has increased by ~7%.
    • HMY says increases in electricity costs and labor costs following a new wage agreement were more than offset by the increased production and savings in overall costs, resulting in cash cost per kilogram 6%-8% lower Q/Q.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • IDCC

    Supreme Court rejects Nokia appeal in InterDigital suit

    • The Supreme Court has rejected an appeal from Nokia asking it to prevent InterDigital (IDCC -2.9%) from pursuing an ITC case related to some of the latter's standards-essential 3G patents, arguing InterDigital couldn't seek a ban because it doesn't make any products of its own.
    • Amazon, H-P, and other companies had called on the Supreme Court to uphold Nokia's appeal, and thereby limit the ITC's authority. Standards-essential patents have become a hot-button political issue, as have IP cases brought about by patent assertion entities.
    • The Supreme Court's ruling clears the way for InterDigital to continue pressing its case. InterDigital's shares fell in June after an ITC administrative law judge cleared Nokia, Huawei, and ZTE of infringing the company's 3G patents in one of its ITC disputes.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • MPO

    Midstates Petroleum +8% after CEO buys 10K shares

    • Midstates Petroleum (MPO +8%) spiked about two hours ago and remains strong after an SEC filing disclosed CEO John Crum purchased 10K shares at an average price of $5.26 for his personal holdings.
    • Crum has accumulated at least 75K shares in the past six months, bringing his total stake to 1,336,301 shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 4 Comments
  • VELTF

    Velti CMO departs, shares plunge again

    • Krishna Subramanian, Velti's (VELT -12.5%) chief marketing officer and the co-founder of its Mobclix mobile ad network, has left the company and says he's now "working on an exciting idea that is keeping me up at night." News of the departure has plunged Velti deeper into penny-stock territory; bankruptcy fears have already been running high.
    • Velti blamed its big Q2 miss on delinquent payments to developers relying on Mobclix (previous). The company has admitted it hasn't been able to "provide sufficient liquidity" for the business, which is now on the block.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • INSM

    Insmed rises after completing enrollment in Arikace NTM trial

    • Insmed (INSM +9.9%) rallies after saying it has completed enrollment in a Phase 2 Arikace study for NTM patients.
    • The company also says it has commenced the SAWP process with the EMA and will discuss Arikace and NTM with the agency in Q4.
    • Due to the challenge associated with enrolling patients who have had six months of ATS/IDSA guideline therapy, "completing enrollment ... is a major accomplishment," the company notes. (PR)
    • Some analysts, including UBS' Matthew Harrison and Leerink's Joseph Schwartz think NTM is where the drug's true potential lies, despite CF trials.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • VECO

    Oppenheimer's Veeco downgrade: Concerns about accounting, earnings

    • Oppenheimer's Andrew Uerkwitz, who downgraded Veeco (VECO -5.3%) to Perform this morning, says he's concerned about the "potential fallout" from Veeco's accounting review, which has been ongoing for nearly a year.
    • Moreover, after updating his financial statements, Uerkwitz thinks the "earnings correction" that will be provided by Veeco when it finally reports will be worse than previously thought.
    • LED equipment peer Aixtron (AIXG -1.3%) is off moderately. Canaccord cut Aixtron to Sell at the beginning of the month, citing Asian share losses.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • ECYT

    Endocyte rallies as vintafolide PRECEDENT results published

    • After tumbling some 20% late last week on news that the vintafolide monotherapy arm in TARGET was (in the opinion of the DSMB) not likely to be declared superior to docetaxel in terms of PFS, Endocyte (ECYT +10.9%) recoups some of its losses as Phase 2 data shows vintafolide plus PLD resulted in a median PFS of 5 months in women with platinum-resistant ovarian cancer versus 2.7 months for the PLD alone group.
    • The Hazard Ratio was 0.63.
    • The results were published in the Journal of Clinical Oncology. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • KZIA

    Novogen adds to gains on huge volume

    • After rallying 20% before the bell, shares of Novogen (NVGN +59.6%) have put together a remarkable rally.
    • Also of note is the volume behind the move. 2M shares have traded hands thus far — the stock's 10-day average volume is just 33K.
    • Earlier: NVGN jumps after bullish article predicts cancer drug partnership.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • CPRX

    DMC recommends continuation of Firdapse trial

    • After reviewing safety and clinical data, the DMC for Catalyst Pharmaceutical's (NASDAQ:CPRX) Phase 3 Firdapse (NASDAQ:BMRN) study in LEMS recommends that the company continue the trial as planned
    • As was the case the last time CPRX issued a PR on a DMC recommendation, the company says enrollment should be complete in Q4 with a top line readout in Q2 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • JCP

    Bankruptcy chatter dismissed by J.C. Penney

    • A spokesperson for J.C. Penney (JCP -6.1%) tells Bloomberg there is no truth to the speculation the company hired bankruptcy attorneys.
    • Shares of JCP nosedived earlier off the rumor before regaining traction.
    • OptionMonster.com's Jon Najarian observes CDS traders aren't reflecting any heightened fears of a bankruptcy filing.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 8 Comments
  • EMN

    Eastman Chemical speculated as Jana target

    • Eastman Chemical (EMN +1.5%) may be the target of activist investor Jana Partners and will be disclosed in an upcoming 13D filing, Stephen Taub of Institutional Investors wrote in an article published last night.
    • Jana and other activists like EMN-style multi-business structures that lend themselves to selling less profitable operations and distributing the proceeds to shareholders, and Jana has experience in the chemicals and related business, Taub says as part of his rationale for a potential move.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: NVGN +60%. MTSL +51%. VISN +51%. TUC +42%. BORN +41%. HPJ +25%. TRIT +20%. THTI +15%. EVK +15%. LOJN +16%.
    • Top 10 Losers: CWTR -29%. MCP -20%. TDC -16%. ALTI -17%. CZR -11%. FLIR -11%. ADHD -6%. REE -10%. PLCC -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • BAS

    Basic Energy Service slips on lower revenue outlook

    • Basic Energy Services (BAS -4%) expects Q4 revenue will fall 6%-7% Q/Q due to seasonal factors, and lower utilization levels could pressure pricing and margins in some markets.
    • As of Sept. 30, BAS' well servicing rig count was unchanged at 425; well servicing rig hours totaled 69,300 producing a rig utilization rate of 71%, vs. 77% in the prior month and 71% a year ago.
    • Iberia Capital downgrades shares to Sector Perform from Outperform, saying BAS "indicated lower utilization levels, coupled with seasonal slowdowns, could pressure pricing in crowded markets."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • APL

    Atlas Pipeline cut to Neutral at Baird on cloudier outlook

    • Atlas Pipeline (APL -4.5%) is downgraded to Neutral from Outperform with a $38 price target, down from $43, at Robert W. Baird after APL's lower, cloudier outlook.
    • APL's negative Q3 pre-announcement underscores the growing effects of ethane rejection across APL's midstream footprint, the firm says; despite burgeoning volumes, the effects of weaker processing economics have become more pronounced in the current quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • IVZ

    Invesco's Neil Woodford exiting company

    • Star fund manager Neil Woodford is leaving Invesco (IVZ -4.4%), effective April 29, with the intention of starting his own fund management business. He will remain responsible for his Invesco funds until he departs, at which point Mark Barnett will succeed him.
    • Invesco: "We have planned for succession for many years and have built a world-class investment culture that develops and supports gifted and experienced managers."
    • Woodford: "I leave the company on good terms and remain fully committed to my fund management responsibilities at Invesco Perpetual until my departure."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney plunges on heavy selling, no news

    • Things are looking bad at noon for J.C. Penney (JCP -7.2%), as shares plunge 5.2% in 20 minutes on heavy volume, large blocks, and no apparent news.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM | 4 Comments
  • C

    Progress at Citi Holdings detailed during earnings call

    • Assets at Citi Holdings are down to 6% of total Citigroup (C +0.4%) assets from 9% a year ago (presentation slide #15), says management on the earnings call (live on Seeking Alpha). Net credit losses of $635M fell from $1.8B a year ago, and the drag on bank income fell to just $102M from $670M a year ago. The amount of mortgages past due fell to $4.97B from $8.29B a year ago.
    • Turning to Citigroup, the higher interest rates didn't yet make an impact, with net interest margin slipping to 2.81% in Q3 from 2.85% in Q2, and 2.88% at the start of the year.
    • A focus of questioning early in the call is on the unexpected build in loan-loss reserves, and management says it's related to about $300M in exposure to three Mexican home builders amid two hurricanes that hit in September.
    • In a pre-call call with reporters, CFO John Gerspach says Citi no longer holds any Treasury paper coming due on October 31 or earlier, adding that his bank isn't the only lender dumping its short-term bills. "We're in uncharted waters."
    • Earlier: Q3 results.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • HFC

    Time to buy the refiners, Howard Weil says

    • Shares of refining companies move higher after Howard Weil's positive note on the sector, whose relative underperformance provides an opportunity for investors who felt they had missed their opportunity to participate in the U.S. energy renaissance to have another shot.
    • The firm singles out three stocks for upgrades: HollyFrontier (HFC +2%) and Valero (VLO +0.2%) are upgraded to Outperform from Sector Perform, while Marathon Petroleum (MPC +1.6%) is made a Focus Stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • NURO

    NeuroMetrix rises on deal for Sensus system

    • NeuroMetrix (NURO +10.1%) jumps after announcing that OsteoArthritis Centers of America will "incorporate the Sensus Pain Management System into its affiliated medical clinics."
    • The deal makes the system available in more than 100 clinics which are affiliates of OsteoArthritis Centers of America parent Rehabilitation Management Group. (PR)
    • Recall that the Sensus System was the first transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulator to receive 501(k) clearance for use during sleep.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp target lowered to $5, EPS outlook slashed at Goldman

    • Molycorp (MCP -17.9%) is maintained with a Neutral rating at Goldman Sachs, but the firm cuts its 2013-15 earnings estimates and lowers its price target to $5 from $6 after MCP announced a $200M capital raise due to lower expectations of future revenue and cash flow.
    • Goldman sees MCP's latest round of fundraising as an indication of continued operational challenges in ramping the Mountain Pass rare earths facility, and notes the $100M increase in the project's overall budget continues a series of cost overruns.
    • But the firm believes the remaining targeted capex of $50M-$70M in Q4 and $70M in 2014 to complete Mountain Pass appears doable assuming a successful capital raise; also, improving rare earth fundamentals could be reflected moving into year-end results.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • VVUS

    Vivus slips, presentation shows Q3 Qsymia TRx at 108K

    • Shares of Vivus (VVUS -1.9%) are weak in morning trading.
    • In a presentation attached to an 8-K filed today, Q3 Qsymia TRx is estimated at 108K (+33% sequentially). (presentation, slide 6)
    • According to chatter, JMP says that works out to $7-8M in revenue, not even half of consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • SD

    SandRidge +3.5% after Leon Cooperman calls it a favorite holding

    • SandRidge Energy (SD +3.5%) is on the move after positive comments from Leon Cooperman on CNBC earlier this morning; he noted shares are trading at $6 and believes the underlying value is ~$10.
    • Even after a proxy fight led to management changes, "we think the news could get progressively better... their acreage position in their production would justify a price probably 50% higher than it is presently."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • CZR

    Volatile day for Caesars Entertainment

    • Shares of Caesars Entertainment (CZR -13.8%) take a tumble after the company announces details of a senior note offering and hits the ex-rights date for the distribution of Caesars Acquisition Company.
    • SEC Form 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • CCIH

    ChinaCache spikes on ebullient sell-side commentary

    • ChinaCache (CCIH +2.9%) shares spike after unofficial sell-side commentary calls the company the "Akamai of China" and pegs its value at $90/share based on peer multiples (versus a previous close of $9.23), according to Notable Calls.
    • The analyst observes that ChinaCache is "the leader in its space, not some second or third tier player," and that "there is an enormous dis-connect in the market right now in how it is valuing the equity of CCIH."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • DGX

    Quest Diagnostics launches lower priced BRCA test

    • It looks like the race to the bottom is on regarding pricing for BRCA testing.
    • Quest Diagnostics (DGX +0.1%) today announced the launch of BRCAvantage "a suite of four new lab-developed genetic tests that identify mutations in BRCA1 and BRCA2 genes, which are associated with increased risk of inherited breast and ovarian cancers." (PR)
    • The bad news for Myriad Genetics (MYGN -2.2%) is that it looks like DGX is pricing the test at $2,500, below MYGN's $3K+ price point (see here, here, and here).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 2 Comments
  • RIO

    Rio Tinto resumes talks with Mongolia over Oyu Tolgoi development

    • Representatives of Rio Tinto (RIO +2%) arrived in Ulaanbaatar yesterday to resume talks with the Mongolian government on resuming construction of underground mining shafts in the Oyu Tolgoi mine, which RIO halted in August due to the government's rejection of its financing proposal on the project.
    • The government says RIO has exceeded the cost limit initially approved by $2B, but faced with deteriorating economic conditions and a shortage of hard currency, it is now attempting to bring the miner back to its investment in the country.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • RWT

    Redwood started a Buy at UBS

    • Finding itself on the wrong end of sell-side opinion of late, Redwood Trust (RWT +1.4%) finds a friend in UBS, which initiates the stock a Buy with $24 price target.
    • The stock has given back a large chunk of big Y/Y gains in the past few months amid higher interest rates and the banks returning to the private-label mortgage business, particularly as jumbo mortgage rates fall below conforming rates.
    • Previous downgrades from FBR and Wells.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • INFA

    Enterprise IT stocks slip following Teradata warning

    • A week after some of them temporarily fell in response to Citrix's warning, enterprise IT names are slumping on account of Teradata's Q3/2013 warning, which was largely the result of weaker-than-expected Asian numbers.
    • Three other data warehousing/business intelligence software providers - Informatica (INFA -4.4%), MicroStrategy (MSTR -4.1%), and Qlik (QLIK -3.3%) are among the biggest decliners. The companies rallied in August in response to Teradata's better-than-feared Q2 report.
    • Other decliners: EMC -1.8%. NTAP -2.1%. CVLT -2.5%. FFIV -2%. JIVE -2.2%. NOW -2%.
    • Teradata isn't alone among enterprise IT names in seeing its Asian ops underperform. Cisco and Oracle have reported similar issues.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • LOJN

    Seeking Alpha moves stocks

    • LoJack (LOJN +11.1%) soars in early action following publication of SA Pro's Valuable Insight's article suggesting this forgotten high-flyer is cheap, but retains plenty of brand equity and growth potential - a possible multi-bagger.
    • Article is embargoed until tomorrow morning.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • AUQ

    AuRico Gold posts fifth straight quarter of production growth

    • AuRico Gold (AUQ +1.8%) releases preliminary Q3 production results, which puts gold output for the quarter at 48,902 oz. and cash costs at $626/oz.
    • AUQ says it remains on target to meet its production and cash costs guidance for the year of 190K-220K oz. at cash costs of $565-$645/oz.
    • Commissioning of the shaft hoisting system at the Young-Davidson underground mine is on schedule toward a Oct. 31 declaration of commercial production.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • SCHW

    Online brokers gain after Schwab results

    • The online brokers are having a big day after Q3 results from Schwab reaffirmed growing retail interest in the stock market. Schwab (SCHW +4.5%) CEO Walt Bettinger noted this quarter's revenue numbers were the company's best ever if excluding the spike experienced at the height of the Internet bubble.
    • TD Ameritrade (AMTD +2.3%), E*Trade (ETFC +0.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • ARNA

    Arena says Eisai to increase size of Belviq sales force

    • Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA +5%) says Belviq marketing partner Eisai (OTCPK:ESALF) is set to double the size of its sales force for the weight-loss drug by December.
    • The move will "will enable Eisai to reach approximately 65K physicians in the U.S.," ARNA notes.
    • Eisai says the expansion "demonstrates the success ... gained in discussing the [drug's] potential value within the payor community, and the subsequent agreements ... reached with many ... payor partners." (PR)
    • Worth noting: In a bearish note late last month, Credit Suisse predicted Eisai would need to hire additional reps in order for the companies to hit the bank's (lowered) Belviq estimates.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • TDC

    A roundup of tech ratings changes

    • Teradata (NYSE:TDC) has been cut to Neutral by Credit Suisse and Sterne Agee, and to Equal Weight by Morgan Stanley, following its Q3/2013 warning. Shares -14.9% premarket.
    • Dassault (OTCPK:DASTY) has been cut to Underweight by HSBC a day after the company reported weaker-than-expected preliminary Q3 results and cut its full-year guidance. Shares -3.2% in Paris.
    • FireEye (NASDAQ:FEYE) has received three bullish coverage launches and four neutral ones on underwriter coverage day. Shares +0.6%.
    • Texas Instruments (NYSE:TXN) has been upgraded to Neutral by Susquehanna. Shares +0.5%.
    • Cogent (NASDAQ:CCOI) has been upgraded to Buy by Citi.
    • Veeco (NASDAQ:VECO) has been cut to Market Perform by Oppenheimer.
    • Marvell (NASDAQ:MRVL) has been started at Outperform by Raymond James.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • KZIA

    Novogen jumps as article predicts imminent cancer partnership

    • Novogen (NVGN) is up some 20% in premarket trading.
    • The move looks to be attributable to an article by SA contributor Small-Cap Momentum Advisors, who calls the stock "the most exciting opportunity ... in the biotech sector in years."
    • Long story short, the author cites a "hidden jewel" in the company's annual report which he says suggests "that a major pharmaceutical company with an extensive background in ovarian cancer treatment ... may partner with NVGN."
    • "This news could hit the tape at any moment," the author adds.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: MTSL +51%. TUC +41%. NVGN +20%. REDF +8%. OCZ +6%. NBG +5%.
    • Losers: CWTR -30%. MCP -18%. TDC -15%. CZR -11%. ALTI -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • ELX

    Emulex pre-announces strong FQ1, shares +7.3% premarket

    • Emulex (NYSE:ELX) expects to report FQ1 (Sep. quarter) revenue of $113M-$114M and EPS of $0.12-$0.13. That's above prior guidance of $109M-$111M and $0.09-$0.11, and a consensus of $111.6M and $0.10. (PR)
    • The maker of storage adapter cards, switches, and controller ICs attributes the numbers to both strong top-line performance and "tighter operational control. They arrive with the company reportedly on the block, and in the midst of a leadership transition.
    • Archrival QLogic (NASDAQ:QLGC) could rally in sympathy. Emulex's full FQ1 results arrive on Oct. 30.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • XNPT

    XenoPort soars as Clinton Group calls for new CEO, renewed focus on XP23829

    • Shares of XenoPort (NASDAQ:XNPT) soar 16.8% premarket as Clinton Group (one of the company's largest shareholders) sends a letter to CEO Ronald Barrett.
    • XNPT's "assets are worth substantially more than the stock price implies," the investment manager writes, putting fair value for the common stock at $13-16/share.
    • Clinton Group is "extremely enthusiastic" about the prospects for XP23829, which Clinton's president Gregory Taxin thinks can challenge Biogen's (NASDAQ:BIIB) MS drug Tecfidera. "It appears to us that 829 is poised to follow in the footsteps of other 'second generation' biotechnology blockbusters that, even with just small improvements in efficacy, dosing or side effects, have proven to be substantial clinical and commercial successes," Taxin says.
    • Ultimately, The Clinton Group wants the company to focus on XP23829 rather than the RLS drug Horizant (which the investment manager essentially says should be written-off as a failure). Furthermore, Taxin says the company "needs a new CEO."
    • Full Letter
     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • SCHW

    Schwab revenue rises 15%; shares gain

    • Q3 net income of $290M gained 17% from a year ago on revenues of $1.4B, up 15%. Pre-tax profit margin of 33.8% compares to 30.2% a year ago. Core net new asset growth of $43B in Q3 was 97% higher than a year ago and the best result ever for a summer quarter. YTD core net new asset growth of 7.4%.
    • Net interest revenue of $506M up 15.3% Y/Y. $180M of fee waivers in Q3 vs. $136M a year ago (this money flows straight to the bottom line if short-term interest rates increase just a small amount).
    • Reaffirmed 2014 outlook assumes ongoing economic recovery and interest rates and client activity "at or above recent levels."
    • SCHW +2.7% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM
  • FLIR

    FLIR Systems reports preliminary Q3 results, shares slide

    • FLIR Systems (NASDAQ:FLIR) reports preliminary Q3 results of $0.32-0.33/share on revenue of $358-360M. Consensus is $0.37/share on sales of $370.98M.
    • Results were "negatively impacted by weakness in markets that have exposure to the U.S. federal government," FLIR notes. More specifically, the company says "lower-than-anticipated unit volumes [and] product mix" hit margins.
    • FLIR also announces plans to shutter six sites and move their operations to larger company facilities. When combined with a planned consolidation of the optics and laser manufacturing businesses, the company should realize cost savings of more than $20M/year.
    • The company will book a pre-tax restructuring charge of $27-30M in Q4. (PR)
    • FLIR -7% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp to offer $200M of stock, shares -20%

    • Molycorp (MCP) says it plans to offer up to $200M of its common stock, or up to $230M if the underwriters exercise their option to purchase additional shares - a major dilution for a company with a $1.3B market cap.
    • MCP said earlier this morning that it expects to generate a negative cash flow in its Q3 and its cash cushion has dwindled to insufficient levels.
    • Shares now -20% premarket.

  • JNJ

    Johnson & Johnson beats estimates, raises guidance

    • Shares of Johnson & Johnson (NYSE:JNJ) are up 1.8% premarket following the company's top and bottom line Q3 beat.
    • Domestic sales rise 1.7% for the quarter, while international sales jump 4.2%.
    • Diluted EPS +8.8% Y/Y.
    • Global consumer sales come in at $3.6B, up 2% Y/Y ex-currency impact.
    • Global pharmaceutical sales rise 10.9% (ex-currency impact) to $7B.
    • Worldwide medical devices sales of $6.9B rise slightly, but fall when adjusted for a negative currency impact of 2.3%.
    • FY13 EPS guidance raised to $5.44-5.49 from $5.40-5.47. Consensus is $5.46. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • DPZ

    Domino's Pizza lower after slight earnings miss

    • Domino's Pizza (NYSE:DPZ) reports domestic same store sales rose 5.4% in Q3 while global stores were just behind with a 5.0% gain.
    • Increased store order counts and improved franchise fees helped offset higher administrative expenses and the impact of foreign exchange, but weren't enough to pull Domino's bottom line up to meet the estimate of analysts.
    • The company's total store count rose 116 Q/Q to 10,556. (PR)
    • DPZ -2.7% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:58 AM

  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp sees negative cash flow in Q3, shares -13.8%

    • Molycorp (MCP) -13.8% premarket after disclosing it expects to generate significantly lower than expected revenue and cash flow, and plans to raise additional financing to ensure adequate funding for capital needs, debt service and other working capital needs.
    • MCP says its cash cushion has dwindled to a level below what it considers sufficient to ensure no substantial concern about the ability to finance.
    • MCP also says it will be unable to sell a substantial portion of the cerium production from its main mine, Mountain Pass in California, in 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM | 4 Comments
  • MSFT

    Jefferies ups Microsoft to Buy

    • "We think the stage is set for a series of value creating events to unfold over the next 18 months," says analyst Ross MacMIllan, upgrading Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) to Buy and lifting his price target to $42 from $33.
    • Among those events is a new operating structure with greater transparency on the best assets, or what MacMillan calls "BestCo" - the commercial segment containing key assets transitioning to the cloud. "OtherCo" is the devices and consumer segment which carry less clear value. MacMillan sees the market allowing a higher valuation to the BestCo operations.
    • As for the new CEO, MacMillan sees the potential for better portfolio focus - i.e. which assets should remain as core and what should be viewed as non-core - as well as someone who sees the company's massive recurring cash flows as opportunity to give more back to shareholders.
    • Shares +1% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 AM | 13 Comments

    • Global equities are mostly higher as markets buy into the optimistic noises emanating from the U.S. that Senate leaders are close to a deal that would lift the debt ceiling and reopen the government.
